com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.newaccounting

Class CapitalEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.newaccounting.CapitalEntity

  • public class CapitalEntity
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a capital entity in a capital structure
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

      • ownership

        private java.math.BigDecimal ownership
        decimal percentage ownership/allocation (0.5, for example); ownership should always be scaled at 3 decimal digits, permitting one digit of percentage scale (45.8, for example, but not 36.75); the number should follow the HALF_UP rounding convention

      • SCALE

        the decimal scale of the ownership percentage

    • Constructor Detail

      • CapitalEntity

        public CapitalEntity(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String capitalAccountName,
                     java.lang.String distributionAccountName,
                     java.math.BigDecimal ownership)
        Create a Partner object.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the capital entity (required)
        capitalAccountName - the name of the capital account (required)
        distributionAccountName - the name of the distribution account
        ownership - the decimal percentage ownership of the company for the partner (should sum to 1 across all partners); the number will be scaled and rounded according to the SCALE and ROUNDING_MODE constants; optional and defaults to 1 (100%)

    • Method Detail

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name.
        Returns:
        a name

        Set the name.
        Parameters:
        name - a name

      • getCapitalAccount

        public Account getCapitalAccount()
        Get the required capital account.
        Returns:
        an account; null means the capital account has not yet been set

      • setCapitalAccount

        public void setCapitalAccount(Account capitalAccount)
        Set the required capital account. Also sets the account name.
        Parameters:
        capitalAccount - the capital account

      • getDistributionAccount

        public Account getDistributionAccount()
        Get the optional distribution account.
        Returns:
        an account, or null if there is no distribution account

      • setDistributionAccount

        public void setDistributionAccount(Account distributionAccount)
        Set the optional distribution account. Also sets the distribution account name.
        Parameters:
        distributionAccount - the distribution account

      • getOwnership

        public java.math.BigDecimal getOwnership()
        Get the ownership.
        Returns:
        a ownership

      • setOwnership

        public void setOwnership(java.math.BigDecimal ownership)
        Set the ownership percentage of the entity as a decimal value (0.5, not 50 for 50%, for example). The method ensures the number is scaled and rounded using the SCALE and ROUNDING_MODE constants.
        Parameters:
        ownership - the ownership percentage as a decimal percentage

      • getCapitalBalance

        java.math.BigDecimal getCapitalBalance(IBuilder builder)
        Get the balance for a specific fiscal year in the entity's capital account from a builder object, which should have built the accounts and the fiscal year before the client calls this method.
        Parameters:
        builder - the builder containing the set of accounts and the fiscal year; required
        Returns:
        the balance of the capital account

      • getDistributionBalance

        java.math.BigDecimal getDistributionBalance(IBuilder builder)
        Get the balance for a specific fiscal year in the entity's distribution account from a builder object, which should have built the accounts and the fiscal year before the client calls this method. If there is no distribution account, the method returns null.
        Parameters:
        builder - the builder containing the set of accounts and the fiscal year; required
        Returns:
        the balance of the distribution account or null if there is no distribution account

      • getAccountBalance

        private java.math.BigDecimal getAccountBalance(Account account,
                                               IBuilder builder)
        Get the current balance of an account in a specific fiscal year using an IBuilder object that contains the current set of accounts being built. This method depends on the builder having built the complete transaction set for the fiscal year.
        Parameters:
        account - the name of the account; required
        builder - the builder, which should have built the fiscal year, the accounts, and the transactions before this call; required
        Returns:
        the balance in the named account

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:

      • setCapitalAccountName

        public void setCapitalAccountName(java.lang.String capitalAccountName)
        Set the capital account name. Only valid if there is no capital account; set the account to set the name in that case.
        Parameters:
        capitalAccountName - a name

        Parameters:
